question: The road surface is most slippery:
a: During a heavy rain or storm
b: Just after the rain
c: Just when it starts raining
answer: Just when it starts raining

a: T-intersection
b: Added lane from the right
c: Two way traffic
answer: Divided highway

question: When approaching a railroad crossing with no warning device, the speed limit is:
a: 15 mph
b: 20 mph
c: 25 mph
answer: 15 mph

a: Pedestrians crossing
b: Work zone, prepare to stop
c: Do Not Enter
answer: Pedestrians crossing

question: When you enter traffic from a stop (ex: pulling away from the curb) you:
a: Should drive slower than other traffic for 200 feet
b: Need a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic
c: Should wait for the first vehicle to pass then pull into the lane
d: Should expect other drivers to make room for you to enter traffic
answer: Need a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic

question: You want to make a right turn at the corner. A pedestrian with a guide dog is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you. Before making your right turn you should:
a: Turn off your engine until the person crosses the street
b: Tell the pedestrian when to cross the street
c: Wait until the person crosses the street
d: Honk the horn to warn the pedestrian of your presence
answer: Wait until the person crosses the street

question: At night if an oncoming vehicle fails to dim its high-beams look:
a: Toward the center of the roadway
b: Toward the right edge of your lane
c: Toward the left edge of your lane
answer: Toward the right edge of your lane

a: Added lane from the right
b: Two way traffic
c: Directional arrow
answer: Added lane from the right

question: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking drugs?
a: Only illegal drugs can impair your driving
b: Even over-the-counter drugs can impair your driving
c: Any prescription drug is safe to use if you don't feel drowsy
answer: Even over-the-counter drugs can impair your driving

a: Crossroad
b: Yield Sign
c: Turn right at limit 25mph
answer: Yield Sign

question: When parking downhill and the curb is absent, your front wheels must be turned:
a: Towards the road
b: Parallel to the road
c: Towards the side of the road
answer: Towards the side of the road

question: You just sold your vehicle. You must notify ______ within 5 days.
a: CHP
b: SJSU
c: Your insuarance provider
answer: DMV

a: No Left Turn
b: Turn right at limit 25mph
c: Keep in the right lane
answer: Two way traffic

question: Dim your high-beam headlights to low-beams within ______ feet when a vehicle is coming towards you.
If you need to slow down or stop when other drivers may not expect it, you should:
a: Use your emergency brake
b: Look over your shoulder for traffic in your blind spot
c: Quickly tap your brake pedal a few times
d: Get ready to blow your horn
answer: Quickly tap your brake pedal a few times

question: California’s “basic speed law” says:
a: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits
b: You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
c: The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways
d: You should drive with at least the speed of 5 mph under any conditions
answer: You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions

question: Parallel parking is when the:
a: Front wheels are turned toward the street
b: Vehicle is in line with other parked vehicles
c: Rear wheels are touching the curb
d: Front wheels are turned against the street
answer: Vehicle is in line with other parked vehicles

a: Slow down, dip area
b: Two way traffic
c: Land ends, merge left
answer: Land ends, merge left

question: If your tires are not inflated to the pressure recommended by the manufacturer it may cause
a: Low gas mileage
b: Uneven tire wear
c: Improper steering
answer: All of the above

question: U-turns in residential districts are legal:
a: When there are no vehicles approaching nearby
b: Across two sets of solid double yellow lines
c: On a one-way street at a green
d: At or on a railroad crossing
answer: When there are no vehicles approaching nearby

a: Stop Sign
b: Merging traffic from the right
c: Stay in current lane
answer: Stop Sign

question: If a pedestrian is in a crosswalk in the middle of a block:
a: The pedestrian has the right-of-way
b: The pedestrian must yield the right-of-way
c: Vehicles have the right-of-way, but drivers must legally take care for the pedestrian safety
d: Drivers must honk the horn approaching the crosswalk, to urge the pedestrian to cross faster
answer: The pedestrian has the right-of-way

question: Orange construction signs warn you:
a: Of workers and road equipment ahead
b: That there are driver services ahead
c: Of an accident ahead
d: That you will have to come to a complete stop shortly
answer: Of workers and road equipment ahead

question: Dim your lights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle:
a: You are approaching from behind
b: Approaching you from behind
c: You have already passed
d: Parked on the shoulder of the road
answer: You are approaching from behind

question: On the intersection, if you see a green arrow pointing to the left, you can:
a: Go in any direction
b: Make a protected turn left
c: Make a turn left or go straight
d: Turn left only if there are no vehicles coming in the opposite direction
answer: Make a protected turn left

question: Smoking inside a vehicle when a person younger than 18 years of age is present is:
a: Legal if it is your child
b: Illegal at all times
c: Not restricted by law
answer: Illegal at all times

question: When passing in the oncoming traffic lane of a two lane road you should consider
a: Your speed relative to others and your ability to accelerate
b: How much clear space you need to pass and how much you have
c: The speed and distance of oncoming traffic and possible hazards
answer: All of the above

question: When a traffic signal light is not working, you should:
a: Stop only if other vehicles are present
b: Slow down and stop if necessary
c: Stop and then continue driving when it is safe
d: Proceed through the intersection as usual
answer: Stop and then continue driving when it is safe

question: When you approach a sharp curve in the road
a: YOU SHOULD Start braking as soon as you enter the curve
b: Start braking before you enter the curve
c: Accelerate into the curve and brake out of it
d: Accelerate through the whole curve to increase traction
answer: Start braking before you enter the curve

question: When you enter a freeway you should check traffic by using
a: The inside and outside mirrors only
b: Only your rearview mirrors
c: All mirrors and turning your head
answer: All mirrors and turning your head

a: No Left Turn
b: Directional arrow
c: Rail-road crossing
d: Turn left if you are in the left lane
answer: Rail-road crossing

question: The car behind you begins to pass you. You should
a: Maintain your speed so traffic will flow smoothly
b: Pull to the right and stop so he can pass
c: Slow down slightly and stay in your lane
d: Blow your horn to allow him to pass
answer: Slow down slightly and stay in your lane

question: What are the colors of a sign which tells you the distance to the next exit of a highway?
a: Yellow with black letters.
b: Black with white letters.
c: Red with white letters.
answer: Green with white letters.

question: You may drive across a sidewalk to:
a: Avoid driving over a speed bump
b: Enter or exit a driveway or alley
c: Make a U-turn
answer: Enter or exit a driveway or alley

a: Wrong Way
b: Traffic signal ahead
c: Winding road
answer: Work zone, prepare to stop

question: You must use your seat belt:
a: Unless you are riding in a vehicle built before 1978
b: Unless you are riding in a limousine
c: And failure to do so may result in a traffic ticket
d: Only when driving on a highway
answer: And failure to do so may result in a traffic ticket

question: Look carefully for motorcycles before you change lanes because:
a: It is illegal for motorcycles to share traffic lanes
b: Their smaller size makes them harder to see
c: They always have the right-of-way at intersections
d: They always have the right-of-way on the highway
answer: Their smaller size makes them harder to see

question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
a: Change lanes and maintain your current speed
b: Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead
c: Slow down because the lane ends ahead
answer: Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead

question: If you are a minor and your cell phone rings while you are driving you should:
a: Answer it if you have a hands-free device
b: Let the call go to voice mail
c: Answer if the call is from your parents
d: Text the caller that you are driving and that you will return the call later
answer: Let the call go to voice mail

question: The "three-second rule" applies to the space _________ of your vehicle.
a: to the sides
b: ahead
c: in back
answer: ahead

a: One-way road
b: T-intersection
c: Do Not Enter
answer: One-way road

question: Who is responsible for knowing how your medications affect your driving?
a: You
b: Your doctor
c: Your pharmacist
answer: You

question: Teenage drivers are more likely to be involved in a crash when
a: They are driving with their peer as a passenger
b: They are driving with adult passengers
c: They are driving with teenage passengers
d: They are driving without any passengers
answer: They are driving with teenage passengers

question: Before you reach the intersection when crossing railroad tracks in slow traffic you should:
a: Sound your horn as you are crossing the tracks
b: Stop on the tracks until your light turns green
c: Stop between the crossing gates in case they close
d: Wait until you can completely cross the tracks before you proceed
answer: Wait until you can completely cross the tracks before you proceed

question: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:
a: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway
b: 5 to 10 MPH slower than the traffic on the freeway
c: Accelerate to reach the speed of at least 60 mph
d: The posted speed limit for traffic on the freeway
answer: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway
